error.signature: ERROR: The cache entry is corrupted: hash mismatch for cached file

verdict.summary: Pip's local cache contains corrupted files, usually from interrupted downloads, disk errors, or running out of space during caching. Cached wheels or sdists fail integrity checks when pip tries to reuse them.

dead_ends.action: Manually edit or patch cached files
dead_ends.why_fails: Cached files are compressed archives with checksums; manual editing breaks integrity and pip will still reject them

dead_ends.action: Change cache directory without clearing the old one
dead_ends.why_fails: Does not fix the root cause; if disk issues caused corruption, the new cache may also become corrupted

workarounds.action: Purge pip cache completely: pip cache purge
Use --no-cache-dir for the immediate install, then purge cache later
Remove specific cached package: pip cache remove <package>
workarounds.condition: when only one package is corrupted

leads_to.condition: when corrupted cache causes hash verification failures

preceded_by.condition: when disk full during download leaves partial cached files

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Cache corruption is about locally cached files being damaged; hash mismatch is about downloaded package not matching the hash in requirements file
